subject: Tennis
lead_paragraph: Lleyton Hewitt needed 2 hours 58 minutes yesterday to beat Stanislas Wawrinka, 7-5, 3-6, 7-6 (5), in the first round of the Western & Southern Financial Group Masters in Mason, Ohio. But recovering from injuries seemed to be the theme of the day.Ninth-seeded James Blake, who withdrew from the Rogers Cup in Montreal last week after straining abdominal muscles during his first-round match, defeated Alejandro Falla, 7-6 (5), 6-1. Last night, Andy Roddick, the defending champion and the third seed, served 13 aces, one of them clocked at 146 miles an hour, in a 7-6 (3), 6-2 victory over Fernando Verdasco.
